intro: Sphaerotorrhiza trifida var. dissecta, commonly known as the dissected sphaerotorrhiza, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a rosette of fleshy, lobed leaves that are finely dissected, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Its flowers are small and typically yellow or orange, clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
